page.title: 18Housing and Landscape
page.content: This is a popular holiday area with many holiday cottages. Some of these are owned by local residents and some by non-locals. Permanent residents are both owner occupiers and tenants. There is a council estate consisting of 27 houses and bungalows, and one is owner occupied. Architecturally Hawkshead is an interesting area, 'a little town that never grew'. One small town house with its own distinctive style is Thimble Hall - timber framed upstairs and jettied outside. An unusual feature found in some of these houses is the use of Brathay slabs which are unique to the Hawkshead area. They are used slightly interlocking horizontally and vertically. The walls in the Information Centre are built with these slabs, which were also used as dividing walls in fields.
